DESCRIPTION.P: Scilab equivalent for Matlab dir depends on plateform on which the program is executed and on inputs:

ITEM.SP: With one input: Scilab unix_w can be used to have an equivalent
With two inputs: Scilab listfiles can help you to find solutions but is not an equivalent

DESCRIPTION.P: The function mtlb_dir(path) is used by mfile2sci to replace dir(path) because converted program can be run on a different plateform from the one used while porting Matlab code to Scilab. This function will determine the correct command at run time. If you want to have a more efficient code it is possible to replace mtlb_dir calls:

ITEM.SP: If program is always run under Windows mtlb_dir(path) may be replaced by unix_w("dir")
If program is always run under Unix/linux mtlb_dir(path) may be replaced by unix_w("ls")
If program can be run under Unix/linux and under Windows mtlb_dir(path) may be replaced by if MSDOS then unix_w("dir");else unix_w("ls");end

DESCRIPTION.P: Caution: mtlb_dir has not to be used for hand coded functions.
